attributes.action: Seek the immediate return of the Danegeld pennies.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Between 856 and 1016 the British people paid approximately 60 million Anglo Saxon pennies to the Danish government in the form of protection money (called the Danegeld) - this protection racket netting the Danish economy an estimated 85,000kg of silver.  The purchasing power of the silver at the time would be equivalent to approximately £1 billion today.  We hereby petition the Prime Minister and the the British Government to demand the immediate return of the Danegeld, plus interest from the Danish government, payable at 1% per annum.  The total amount of £19163.79 billion should be paid in silver pennies along with a written assurance from Queen Margrethe II of Denmark that the Danish people will never again make such demands.

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
